result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody W. Petrausch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages unless given written approval by Agent. 
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present. 
Defendant shall not associate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Patrick J Carroll unless given written permission by Agent.

Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: C: Defendant, DOC
C: Defendant, DOC

Defendant Cody W Petrausch in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Court questions defendant and advises of rights. 
Defendant enters No Contest pleas to the following: 
15CM172 counts 1 & 5, 
15CM244 count 4, 
15CM407 counts 2, 3 & 5, 
15CM425 count 1. 
State has complied with victim notification. 
Court finds the defendant guilty of: 
15CM172 counts 1 & 5 (counts 2-4 & 6-10 dismissed and read in), 
15CM244 count 4 (count 3 dismissed and read in), 
15CM407 counts 2, 3 & 5 (count 4 dismissed and read in), 
15CM425 count 1. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation each count concurrent. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment 
- not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages unless given written approval by Agent 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- not associate with individuals in possession of illegal substances or drug paraphernalia 
- obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 72 hours of any new or changing prescriptions 
- no contact directly or indirectly with Patrick J Carroll unless given written permission by Agent 
Defendant advised of appeal rights. 
Defendant questions Court regarding revocation in TR case. 
Court advises minimum sentence was ordered.
